English name: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE STRATEGY FOR THE DIGITAL GOVERNMENT
Description: This published document materializes this strategy so that the Public Administration uses artificial intelligence in the development of public services and in the improvement of its internal processes.
Objective(s): The general objective of the strategy is to promote and strengthen the responsible use of AI in Public Administration. Within that framework, four pillars that make up this strategy have been identified, each with specific objectives and lines of action.AI governance in Public Administration.Capacity development for AI.Use and application of AI.Digital citizenship and AI.
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Ethics of emerging technologies|Strategic policy intelligence
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Degree of coordination in implementing strategy (select the highest that applies): 2- Public bodies are expected to plan activities based on strategy|Focuses on the following area(s) of the national innovation system: Governance|Follow-up mechanism: Action plan, Periodic monitoring and/or evaluation of progress|Foresight exercise included: Yes|Societal challenge(s) emphasised: None specifically emphasised|Specific business sector(s) targeted: None specifically targeted|Strategy mainly prioritises: STI policy governance (e.g. vertical and horizontal coordination, evaluation)

English name: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE STRATEGY FOR THE DIGITAL GOVERNMENT
Description: This published document materializes this strategy so that the Public Administration uses artificial intelligence in the development of public services and in the improvement of its internal processes.
Objective(s): The general objective of the strategy is to promote and strengthen the responsible use of AI in Public Administration. Within that framework, four pillars that make up this strategy have been identified, each with specific objectives and lines of action.AI governance in Public Administration.Capacity development for AI.Use and application of AI.Digital citizenship and AI.
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Ethics of emerging technologies|Strategic policy intelligence
Policy instrument type: Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts
Policy instrument description(s):
This first version was generated by a multidisciplinary working group of Agesic professionals who come from different fields such as technology, law, sociology, and medicine, among others. This holistic approach provides different perspectives on how to address the challenge.
This working group began researching state-of-the-art situations, in particular, examining the experience of countries such as Canada and Italy, pioneers in addressing artificial intelligence strategies focused on digital government. These activities involved the study of work processes and generated documents, as well as exchange instances with directly involved experts.
After this initial stage, this document began to shape up and its main objective is, as mentioned above, to promote the responsible use of AI throughout the public administration, with a focus on generating better digital services and working processes.
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Method: Participatory workshops and seminars, Focus groups|Number of participants: 25 to 100|Stakeholders contribute to: Policy design

English name: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE STRATEGY FOR THE DIGITAL GOVERNMENT
Description: This published document materializes this strategy so that the Public Administration uses artificial intelligence in the development of public services and in the improvement of its internal processes.
Objective(s): The general objective of the strategy is to promote and strengthen the responsible use of AI in Public Administration. Within that framework, four pillars that make up this strategy have been identified, each with specific objectives and lines of action.AI governance in Public Administration.Capacity development for AI.Use and application of AI.Digital citizenship and AI.
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Ethics of emerging technologies|Strategic policy intelligence
Policy instrument type: Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities
Policy instrument description(s):
To implement dissemination and awareness campaigns that allow to transmit to the public what Artificial Intelligence is and how it is being used by the Public Administration.
To strengthen the mechanisms so that citizens know their rights in the digital sphere and how to exercise them.
To promote the development of Digital Intelligence, in its three levels (digital citizenship, creativity and digital initiative) to enhance the involvement, participation and apprehension in the development and application of AI solutions.
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Aspect(s) being promoted: Science, Technology, Innovation, Other|Medium: Other

English name: Data Science and Machine Learning Roadmap
Original name(s): Hoja de ruta en ciencia de datos y aprendizaje autom√°tico
Description: Middle term roadmap for Data Science and Machine learnign development in Uruguay
Background: The National System of Productive Transformation and Competitiveness - Transforma Uruguay- was created with the purpose of promote productive and innovative economic development, with sustainability, equity social and environmental and territorial balance.
Objective(s):
Improve the availability at national level of present and future human resources with
competences in data science and its applications, adapting and improving
training capacities at the different formal and non-formal educational levels, to
through a flexible and decentralized training model. Strengthen the tools for stimulating R&D and development of instruments
suitable to support and consolidate DS / ML research and innovation at the level
national. Develop measures to promote and facilitate criteria that give guarantees and confidence to
society about the forms of application and proper use of these technologies,
ensuring the protection of their rights, avoiding biases, discrimination and others
possible negative impacts and favoring people's capacities against the
resolution of ethical dilemmas. Promote the incorporation of DS/ML in the productive, commercial and commercial sectors
strategic services (public and private) to improve their capacity to
operation and impact, its productivity and strengthen its competitiveness in the
regional and global market. Promote the incorporation of DS/ML into the public sector as a priority policy for the
Development of Digital Government and improvement in the quality and efficiency of services public
Responsible organisation(s): National System of Productive Transformation and Competitiveness (TU;Transforma Uruguay)
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Ethics of emerging technologies|Strategic policy intelligence
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Degree of coordination in implementing strategy (select the highest that applies): 2- Public bodies are expected to plan activities based on strategy|Focuses on the following area(s) of the national innovation system: Research, Business (innovation and/or entrepreneurship), Education and skills, Governance|Follow-up mechanism: Periodic monitoring and/or evaluation of progress|Foresight exercise included: Yes|Societal challenge(s) emphasised: None specifically emphasised|Specific business sector(s) targeted: None specifically targeted|Strategy mainly prioritises: STI policy governance (e.g. vertical and horizontal coordination, evaluation)
